6#include <string>
7#include <cstddef>
8#include <type_traits>
9#include <utility>
10#include <uv.h>
11#include "loop.h"
12#include "underlying_type.hpp"

15namespace uvw {
16
17
18namespace details {
19
20
21enum class UVThreadCreateFlags: std::underlying_type_t<uv_thread_create_flags> {
22 THREAD_NO_FLAGS = UV_THREAD_NO_FLAGS,
23 THREAD_HAS_STACK_SIZE = UV_THREAD_HAS_STACK_SIZE
24};
25
26
27}
28
29
30class Thread;
31class ThreadLocalStorage;
32class Once;
33class Mutex;
34class RWLock;
35class Semaphore;
36class Condition;
37class Barrier;
38
39
40/**
41 * @brief The Thread wrapper.
42 *
43 * To create a `Thread` through a `Loop`, arguments follow:
44 *
45 * * A callback invoked to initialize thread execution. The type must be such
46 * that it can be assigned to an `std::function<void(std::shared_ptr<void>)>`.
47 * * An optional payload the type of which is `std::shared_ptr<void>`.
48 */
49class Thread final: public UnderlyingType<Thread, uv_thread_t> {
50 using InternalTask = std::function<void(std::shared_ptr<void>)>;
51
52 static void createCallback(void *arg);
53
54public:
55 using Options = details::UVThreadCreateFlags;
56 using Task = InternalTask;
57 using Type = uv_thread_t;
58
59 explicit Thread(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref, Task t, std::shared_ptr<void> d = nullptr) noexcept;
60
61 /**
62 * @brief Obtains the identifier of the calling thread.
63 * @return The identifier of the calling thread.
64 */
65 static Type self() noexcept;
66
67 /**
68 * @brief Compares thread by means of their identifiers.
69 * @param tl A valid instance of a thread.
70 * @param tr A valid instance of a thread.
71 * @return True if the two threads are the same thread, false otherwise.
72 */
73 static bool equal(const Thread &tl, const Thread &tr) noexcept;
74
75 ~Thread() noexcept;
76
77 /**
78 * @brief Creates a new thread.
79 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
80 */
81 bool run() noexcept;
82
83 /**
84 * @brief Creates a new thread.
85 *
86 * Available flags are:
87 *
88 * * `Thread::Options::THREAD_NO_FLAGS`: no flags set.
89 * * `Thread::Options::THREAD_HAS_STACK_SIZE`: if set, `stack` specifies a
90 * stack size for the new thread. 0 indicates that the default value should
91 * be used (it behaves as if the flag was not set). Other values will be
92 * rounded up to the nearest page boundary.
93 *
94 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
95 */
96 bool run(Flags<Options> opts, std::size_t stack = {}) noexcept;
97
98 /**
99 * @brief Joins with a terminated thread.
100 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
101 */
102 bool join() noexcept;
103
104private:
105 std::shared_ptr<void> data;
106 Task task;
107};
108
109
110/**
111 * @brief The ThreadLocalStorage wrapper.
112 *
113 * A storage area that can only be accessed by one thread. The variable can be
114 * seen as a global variable that is only visible to a particular thread and not
115 * the whole program.
116 */
117class ThreadLocalStorage final: public UnderlyingType<ThreadLocalStorage, uv_key_t> {
118public:
119 explicit ThreadLocalStorage(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref) noexcept;
120
121 ~ThreadLocalStorage() noexcept;
122
123 /**
124 * @brief Gets the value of a given variable.
125 * @tparam T Type to which to cast the opaque storage area.
126 * @return A pointer to the given variable.
127 */
128 template<typename T>
129 T* get() noexcept {
130 return static_cast<T*>(uv_key_get(UnderlyingType::get()));
131 }
132
133 /**
134 * @brief Sets the value of a given variable.
135 * @tparam T Type of the variable to store aside.
136 * @param value A valid pointer to the variable to store
137 */
138 template<typename T>
139 void set(T *value) noexcept {
140 return uv_key_set(UnderlyingType::get(), value);
141 }
142};
143
144
145/**
146 * @brief The Once wrapper.
147 *
148 * Runs a function once and only once. Concurrent calls to `once` will block all
149 * callers except one (itâ€™s unspecified which one).
150 */
151class Once final: public UnderlyingType<Once, uv_once_t> {
152 static uv_once_t* guard() noexcept;
153
154public:
155 using UnderlyingType::UnderlyingType;
156
157 /**
158 * @brief Runs a function once and only once.
159 *
160 * The callback must be such that it's convertible to `void(*)(void)`. Free
161 * functions and non-capturing lambdas are both viable solutions.
162 *
163 * @tparam F Type of the callback.
164 * @param f A valid callback function.
165 */
166 template<typename F>
167 static void once(F &&f) noexcept {
168 using CallbackType = void(*)(void);
169 static_assert(std::is_convertible_v<F, CallbackType>);
170 CallbackType cb = f;
171 uv_once(guard(), cb);
172 }
173};
174
175
176/**
177 * @brief The Mutex wrapper.
178 *
179 * To create a `Mutex` through a `Loop`, arguments follow:
180 *
181 * * An option boolean that specifies if the mutex is a recursive one. The
182 * default value is false, the mutex isn't recursive.
183 */
184class Mutex final: public UnderlyingType<Mutex, uv_mutex_t> {
185 friend class Condition;
186
187public:
188 explicit Mutex(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref, bool recursive = false) noexcept;
189
190 ~Mutex() noexcept;
191
192 /**
193 * @brief Locks the mutex.
194 */
195 void lock() noexcept;
196
197 /**
198 * @brief Tries to lock the mutex.
199 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
200 */
201 bool tryLock() noexcept;
202
203 /**
204 * @brief Unlocks the mutex.
205 */
206 void unlock() noexcept;
207};
208
209
210/**
211 * @brief The RWLock wrapper.
212 */
213class RWLock final: public UnderlyingType<RWLock, uv_rwlock_t> {
214public:
215 explicit RWLock(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref) noexcept;
216
217 ~RWLock() noexcept;
218
219 /**
220 * @brief Locks a read-write lock object for reading.
221 */
222 void rdLock() noexcept;
223
224 /**
225 * @brief Tries to lock a read-write lock object for reading.
226 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
227 */
228 bool tryRdLock() noexcept;
229
230 /**
231 * @brief Unlocks a read-write lock object previously locked for reading.
232 */
233 void rdUnlock() noexcept;
234
235 /**
236 * @brief Locks a read-write lock object for writing.
237 */
238 void wrLock() noexcept;
239
240 /**
241 * @brief Tries to lock a read-write lock object for writing.
242 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
243 */
244 bool tryWrLock() noexcept;
245
246 /**
247 * @brief Unlocks a read-write lock object previously locked for writing.
248 */
249 void wrUnlock() noexcept;
250};
251
252
253/**
254 * @brief The Semaphore wrapper.
255 *
256 * To create a `Semaphore` through a `Loop`, arguments follow:
257 *
258 * * An unsigned integer that specifies the initial value for the semaphore.
259 */
260class Semaphore final: public UnderlyingType<Semaphore, uv_sem_t> {
261public:
262 explicit Semaphore(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref, unsigned int value) noexcept;
263
264 ~Semaphore() noexcept;
265
266 /**
267 * @brief Unlocks a semaphore.
268 */
269 void post() noexcept;
270
271 /**
272 * @brief Locks a semaphore.
273 */
274 void wait() noexcept;
275
276 /**
277 * @brief Tries to lock a semaphore.
278 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
279 */
280 bool tryWait() noexcept;
281};
282
283
284/**
285 * @brief The Condition wrapper.
286 */
287class Condition final: public UnderlyingType<Condition, uv_cond_t> {
288public:
289 explicit Condition(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref) noexcept;
290
291 ~Condition() noexcept;
292
293 /**
294 * @brief Signals a condition.
295 *
296 * This function shall unblock at least one of the threads that are blocked
297 * on the specified condition variable (if any threads are blocked on it).
298 */
299 void signal() noexcept;
300
301 /**
302 * @brief Broadcasts a condition.
303 *
304 * This function shall unblock threads blocked on a condition variable.
305 */
306 void broadcast() noexcept;
307
308 /**
309 * @brief Waits on a condition.
310 *
311 * These function atomically releases the mutex and causes the calling
312 * thread to block on the condition variable.
313 *
314 * @param mutex A mutex locked by the calling thread, otherwise expect
315 * undefined behavior.
316 */
317 void wait(Mutex &mutex) noexcept;
318
319 /**
320 * @brief Waits on a condition.
321 *
322 * These function atomically releases the mutex and causes the calling
323 * thread to block on the condition variable.<br/>
324 * The functions returns with an error if the absolute time specified passes
325 * (that is, system time equals or exceeds it) before the condition is
326 * signaled or broadcasted, or if the absolute time specified has already
327 * been passed at the time of the call.
328 *
329 * @param mutex A mutex locked by the calling thread, otherwise expect
330 * undefined behavior.
331 * @param timeout The maximum time to wait before to return.
332 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
333 */
334 bool timedWait(Mutex &mutex, uint64_t timeout) noexcept;
335};
336
337
338/**
339 * @brief The Barrier wrapper.
340 *
341 * To create a `Barrier` through a `Loop`, arguments follow:
342 *
343 * * An unsigned integer that specifies the number of threads that must call
344 * `wait` before any of them successfully return from the call. The value
345 * specified must be greater than zero.
346 */
347class Barrier final: public UnderlyingType<Barrier, uv_barrier_t> {
348public:
349 explicit Barrier(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref, unsigned int count) noexcept;
350
351 ~Barrier() noexcept;
352
353 /**
354 * @brief Synchronizes at a barrier.
355 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
356 */
357 bool wait() noexcept;
358};
359
360
361}
362

365#include "thread.cpp"
366#endif
